data.title: Debbie Cenziper
data.meta_description: Debbie Cenziper is a Pulitzer Prize-winning investigative reporter and nonfiction author who writes for ProPublica’s national desk. She spent more than a decade…
data.text: Debbie Cenziper is a Pulitzer Prize-winning investigative reporter and nonfiction author who writes for ProPublica’s national desk. She spent more than a decade at The Washington Post. Cenziper was one of the lead reporters at The Washington Post on the award-winning Pandora Papers, a 2021 investigation about the secret movement of wealth around the world. She is the author of Citizen 865: The Hunt for Hitler’s Hidden Soldiers in America, and Love Wins: The Lovers and Lawyers Who Fought the Landmark Case for Marriage Equality, named one of the most notable books of the year by The Washington Post. Cenziper is a professor at the Medill School of Journalism at Northwestern University.
